endpoint.description: The base endpoint of Confluent Cloud API. Defaults to `https://api.confluent.cloud`.

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries of HTTP client. Defaults to 4.

schema_registry_api_key.description: The Schema Registry Cluster API Key.

schema_registry_api_secret.description: The Schema Registry Cluster API Secret.

schema_registry_rest_endpoint.description: The Schema Registry Cluster REST Endpoint.

description.description: A free-form description of the API key.

display_name.description: A human-readable name for the API key.

api_version.description: The API version of the referred owner.

id.description: The unique identifier for the referred resource.

kind.description: The kind of the referred resource.

The resource associated with this object. The only resource that is supported is 'cmk.v2.Cluster', 'srcm.v2.Cluster'.

api_version.description: The API version of the referred owner.

id.description: The unique identifier for the referred owner.

kind.description: The kind of the referred owner.

block.description: The owner to which the API Key belongs. The owner can be one of 'iam.v2.User', 'iam.v2.ServiceAccount'.

config.description: The custom cluster link settings to set (e.g., `"acl.sync.ms" = "5100"`).

connection_mode.description: The connection mode of the Cluster Link. Defaults to `OUTBOUND`.

link_mode.description: The mode of the Cluster Link. Defaults to `DESTINATION`.

link_name.description: The name of the Cluster Link.

bootstrap_endpoint.description: The bootstrap endpoint used by Kafka clients to connect to the Kafka cluster. (e.g., `SASL_SSL://pkc-00000.us-central1.gcp.confluent.cloud:9092` or pkc-00000.us-central1.gcp.confluent.cloud:9092`).

id.description: The unique identifier for the referred Kafka cluster.

rest_endpoint.description: The REST endpoint of the Kafka cluster (e.g., `https://pkc-00000.us-central1.gcp.confluent.cloud:443`).

secret.description: The Kafka API Secret for your Confluent Cloud cluster.

block.description: The Kafka API Credentials.

secret.description: The Kafka API Secret for your Confluent Cloud cluster.

block.description: The Kafka API Credentials.

config_nonsensitive.description: The nonsensitive configuration settings to set (e.g., `"time.interval" = "DAILY"`).

config_sensitive.description: The sensitive configuration settings to set (e.g., `"gcs.credentials.config" = "**REDACTED***"`). Should not be set for an import operation.

id.description: The unique identifier for the environment.

id.description: The Kafka cluster ID (e.g., `lkc-12345`).

description.description: A description of the Identity Pool.

display_name.description: A name for the Identity Pool.

filter.description: A filter expression that must be evaluated to be true to use this identity pool.

identity_claim.description: A JWT claim to extract the authenticating principal to Confluent resources.

id.description: The unique identifier for the Identity Provider.

block.description: Identity Provider objects represent external OAuth/OpenID Connect providers within Confluent Cloud.

description.description: A description of the Identity Provider.

display_name.description: A name for the Identity Provider.

issuer.description: A publicly reachable issuer URI for the Identity Provider.

pattern_type.description: The pattern type for the ACL.

resource_name.description: The resource name for the ACL.

principals.description: A list of service accounts and identity pools. Special name "default" can be used to represent the default quota for all users and service accounts.

id.description: The unique identifier for the environment.

block.description: Environment objects represent an isolated namespace for your Confluent resources for organizational purposes.

id.description: The Kafka cluster ID (e.g., `lkc-12345`).

egress_byte_rate.description: The egress throughput limit in bytes per second.

ingress_byte_rate.description: The ingress throughput limit in bytes per second.

block.description: Block for representing a Kafka Quota.

api_version.description: API Version defines the schema version of this representation of a Kafka cluster.

availability.description: The availability zone configuration of the Kafka cluster.

bootstrap_endpoint.description: The bootstrap endpoint used by Kafka clients to connect to the Kafka cluster.

cloud.description: The cloud service provider that runs the Kafka cluster.

display_name.description: The name of the Kafka cluster.

kind.description: Kind defines the object Kafka cluster represents.

rbac_crn.description: The Confluent Resource Name of the Kafka cluster suitable for confluent_role_binding's crn_pattern.

region.description: The cloud service provider region where the Kafka cluster is running.

rest_endpoint.description: The REST endpoint of the Kafka cluster.

cku.description: The number of Confluent Kafka Units (CKUs) for Dedicated cluster types. MULTI_ZONE dedicated clusters must have at least two CKUs.

encryption_key.description: The ID of the encryption key that is used to encrypt the data in the Kafka cluster.

display_name.description: The name of the ksqlDB cluster.

resource_name.description: The Confluent Resource Name of the ksqlDB cluster.

rest_endpoint.description: The API endpoint of the ksqlDB cluster.

storage.description: The amount of storage (in GB) provisioned to the ksqlDB cluster.

topic_prefix.description: Topic name prefix used by this ksqlDB cluster. Used to assign ACLs for this ksqlDB cluster to use.

use_detailed_processing_log.description: Controls whether the row data should be included in the processing log topic. Set it to `false` if you don't want to emit sensitive information to the processing log. Defaults to `true`. Defaults to `true`.

id.description: The credential_identity to which this belongs. The credential_identity can be one of iam.v2.User, iam.v2.ServiceAccount.
The unique identifier for the environment.

block.description: Environment objects represent an isolated namespace for your Confluent resources for organizational purposes.

id.description: The Kafka cluster ID (e.g., `lkc-12345`).

cidr.description: The IPv4 CIDR block to used for this network. Must be /16. Required for VPC peering and AWS TransitGateway.

cloud.description: The cloud service provider in which the network exists.

dns_domain.description: The root DNS domain for the network if applicable. Present on networks that support PrivateLink.

region.description: The cloud service provider region where the network exists.

resource_name.description: The Confluent Resource Name of the Network.

zonal_subdomains.description: The DNS subdomain for each zone. Present on networks that support PrivateLink. Keys are zones and values are DNS domains.

zones.description: The 3 availability zones for this network. They can optionally be specified for only AWS networks used with PrivateLink. Otherwise, they are automatically chosen by Confluent Cloud.

account.description: The AWS account ID associated with the Confluent Cloud VPC.

private_link_endpoint_service.description: The endpoint service of the Confluent Cloud VPC (used for PrivateLink) if available.

block.description: Network DNS config. It applies only to the PRIVATELINK network connection type.

id.description: The unique identifier for the environment.

block.description: Environment objects represent an isolated namespace for your Confluent resources for organizational purposes.

private_service_connect_service_attachme.description: The mapping of zones to Private Service Connect service attachments if available. Keys are zones and values are [GCP Private Service Connect service attachment](https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/configure-private-service-connect-producer#api_7).

account.description: AWS account for VPC to peer with the network.

routes.description: List of routes for the peering.

vpc.description: The id of the AWS VPC to peer with.

id.description: The unique identifier for the environment.

block.description: Environment objects represent an isolated namespace for your Confluent resources for organizational purposes.

import_custom_routes.description: Enable customer route import. Defaults to `false`.

project.description: The name of the GCP project.

vpc_network.description: The name of the GCP VPC network to peer with.

role_name.description: The name of the role to bind to the principal.

hard_delete.description: Controls whether a schema should be soft or hard deleted. Set it to `true` if you want to hard delete a schema on destroy. Defaults to `false` (soft delete). Defaults to `false`.

recreate_on_update.description: Controls whether a schema should be recreated on update. Defaults to `false`.
